runs.comm: short of a good length, outside the off, and Gayle slaps that through point. The fielder gets a hand to it but can't stop it. The outfield is quick and the ball races away.
short of a driving length and on the stumps, no room for Gayle to swing his arms, defended back down the pitch
full and on the stump, whipped uppishly to the leg side but down to mid-on
full and just a touch of swing in to the left-handed batsman, defended towards square-leg and another run
short of a length and outside the off, thumped through extra-cover off the back foot
punched to cover and it's a dot ball to end the first over in this ICC World Twenty20
full and outside the off, steered down to third-man
sliced away through point, uppish but well wide of the fielder
extra pace and bounce! Just outside the off and the ball flies away past the outside edge
exellent start this from Ntini, short of a length and pacy, played away down to the off side
a bit of width and chopped but the ball won't beat Gibbs at point, just two runs off this over so far
short of a length and just outside the off, Smith sees the length early and plays a pull through midwicket
Maximum! just drifting onto leg and Gayle smites the ball over the on side. That's flat and sails straight over square-leg for the first six of the tournament
short of a length and outside the off, pulled but not particularly convincingly
fullish and quite straight, defended to the on side
well down the leg side, left easily alone and the umpire has no doubt in calling that wide
whipped away once more. Gayle picks the ball off from the stumps and slaps it over midwicket for another boundary
bouncer but it's quite slow and drifting down leg, helped along towards fine-leg
very full and on the off stump, defended down to the off side
full and quite wide outside the off, big swing and a miss from the batsman, through to  the keeper
another big heave outside the off, once again the ball is slanted away from the bat and beats the outside edge
short of a length and on the pads, clipped to the on side
short of a good length and outside the off, Gayle stands tall and powers the ball to the off side, Graeme Smith somehow fields at mid-off
Huge! Gayle plants his foot down the pitch and heaves the ball over long-on. That is a very big hit from Gayle.
This one is monstrous. Gayle plants his foot down the pitch and tees off. This time it's over long-off and really really big. The ball lands well back in the stands
short and wide but a bit of pace allows the ball to beat the flashing bat, through to the keeper
short and wide once more, cut away but the ball is half stopped at point
short of a length and on the pads, flick played and missed, off the pads to the leg side
short of a good length and on the pads, once again played and missed, the ball raps pad
full and on the pads, clipped away towards fine-leg
short of a length once more and pretty straight, swatted away to the leg side
good-length ball on the stumps, Gayle plays back over the bowler's head but hasn't quite timed that one
short of a length and on the off, hammered away through cover, Gayle throws everything he has at it, the ball races away to the fence and that brings up the fifty partnership
Gayle backs away to leg and Morkel follows him with a quick short ball, no chance of hitting that away. Excellent bowling
fuller and on the pads, clipped through the on side for a single
short of a length and outside the off, cut away into the gap but there's a fielder on the ropes at third-man
again Gayle backs off towards leg, again the bowler follows him and cramps him up for room. Clever bowling this
this time Smith gives himself room and he's successful, chopping the ball away through backward of square on the off side
a delicate shimmy down the pitch and an ungainly across-the-line heave, Smith manages to get ball away through the on-side but hasn't hit it at all well
short of a length and outside the off, pulled away down towards long-on
swatted down to fine-leg
slower ball on the stumps, Smith has picked it and works it through midwicket, the fielder tidies up on the ropes
short one outside the off and it disappears, pulled away magnificently in front of aquare
full and straight, Gayle drives back past the bowler, Albie Morkel dives brilliantly on the ropes and saves the ball
short, wide and Gayle moves to leg and slices the ball away. Not quite in control but the ball easily sails over the fielder at third-man
pacy and outside the off, swing and a miss, through to the keeper
very full and outside the off, steered down towards point where Gibbs dives and fields
short of a good length and outside the off, played down through cover for a single that gets Gayle te first half-century of this tournament, off only 26 balls
full and outside the off, played at and missed but the batsman won't be too disappointed, it's a no-ball and this will be the first free hit of the tournament
Short and on the stumps, played at and missed, the no-ball didn't cost much
fullish and on the off, smashed away over midwicket. That's a big hit from Gayle. Yet another one, rather
very full and on the pads, attempted yorker, worked through leg
short of a length and on the stumps, pulled awkwardly down to long-on
slower ball, it's the off-cutted, worked through square-leg for a single
full and down the leg side, that's a terrible ball with the keeper standing up. Five wides!
full-toss on the off, slapped down to point to end the over
down the leg side, short of a length, played at and missed, through to the keeper and the wide is called despite appeals for the caught behind
short of a length and outside the off, played down to third-man
well down the leg side and once again wide called. Not very clever from the bowler
full and on the toes, inswinging yorker, dug out for a single
fullish and outside the off, driven down to long off but just a single
Baseball style clout! full-toss outside the off, Gayle sees it and hits it cleanly over midwicket. That brings up the hundred and Gayle now has six sixes, the maximum in an innings in Twenty20
low full-toss outside the off, carved through cover for a boundary. Gayle's racing along and could well become the first centurion in this form of the game
eased down to long-on for a single to end the over
Full and straight and a rare dot ball. Hit straight back down the track.
fullish, on the leg stump line, tucked past square leg for a single

full in length, on the off stump line, Smith shuffles right across, ends up outside off stump and tucks it to Albie Morker at backward square leg , within the circle, and he misfields. They get two runs.
backs away to the leg side and taps a length delivery to the off side.
There comes the lemon cut. Full and spearing in on the leg stump, Gayle's bat comes down in an arc, just outside the line and he squeeses it past the leg stump, down to fine leg
the outside edge this time. It was low dipping full toss from round the stumps and  Gayle goes for a flashy drive and gets a outside edge to third man
Whack. Good old fashioned slog. On a length, outside off stump and he smoked it over extra cover
Twhack. Six over long-on. Easy. It was in the slot, on the middle stump, Gayle cleared his front foot and slogged it over the long-on fielder. Gayle is playing Stick Cricket out there
Another big swing of the bat, this time down to the long-off region
criminal mistake! he misses a slog. On the leg stump line, he threatened to hit it out of the ground, bat meets air, the ball meets the pad
Ah! The reverse sweep. Why not, try everything in this game. Lapped past the short third man fielder.

Swing and a miss. Yorker, swinging just outside leg stump line, Gayle had cleared the front leg and tried a swipe across the line, missed and the ball went between his legs. No naughty comments please!

Hello?! A slow loopy bouncer has Gayle completely flummoxed. It landed in the middle of the track and climbed, ever so slowly, like an old man, Gayle was ready to duck and then sees the ball lobbing towards him. He just couldn't do anything with and watched it helplessly as it went past the off stump
Gayle goes down town. Full, in the middle and leg line, he clears the front leg and hits it cleanly over long-on. up up and over
Another biggie.: to the wide long on region. Even bigger. This one sails into the crowd.
short in length, outside off stump, Smith tries to chop it to backward point but misses
swing and a miss outside off stump,  Smith tries to cut but makes no contact
third time lucky for Pollock. Quite similar to the first two deliveries, a tad closer to the body, Smith tries to square-cut  and feathers a edge to the 'keeper.
What a start by Samuels! Banged in short, chest-high, on the leg stump line, Samuels goes for a pull shot and gets a top edge. But it keeps travelling and ends up over backward square leg boundary
low full toss, on the stumps, mistimes a drive to midwicket
driven through the gap between mid-off and cover
A six and he is gone. Full-pitched, on the off stump line, Samuels goes for a big heave down the ground but ends up scooping it straight to de villiers at  long-off.
Another slow bouncer from Pollock but this one climbs over Gayle's head. Wide called.
That's it! Gayle has broken the barrier. He has the first ton in this Twenty20 format. Full-pitched on the middle stump line, driven down the ground. All along the ground.
way down the leg side.
spears this one well outside the off stump. Wide again.
Ouch! Pollock hurls in a yorker, Gayle tries to swipe it away, gets a inside edge to the right ankle and he twisted the right ankle as he tried to recover.
Bang. Low full toss, on the off stump line and Gayle smokes it straight down the ground. No chance whatsover for the men at the ropes.

He goes again. What a party he is having. He moved the front leg outside the leg stump, even before Pollock delivered the ball and carved a full-length delivery over deep midwicket. Twenty20 is made for Gayle.
from round the stumps, homing in on the off stump, Chanders stays back to push it to backward point region.
from the round the stumps, Gayle shuffles right across, ends up outside off stump and can't reach the ball slipping down the leg side

It's a simple technique Gayle uses. He just clears the front leg outside the line and goes right through the line. This one - a full delivery on the middle stump, an attempted yorker - has been driven down the ground
even before the ball was delivered, Gayle placed the front leg outside the leg stump, opened up his stance and tried to whack a length delivery over midwicket but ended up edging it to midwicket
he backs away to the leg side, a yorker is fired on the off and middle line, Gayle brings the bat down in a hurry and squeezes it to long-on
Full in length, on the leg and middle line, Chanderpaul shuffles across, tries to tickle it away but misses and the ball runs off the pad
lands on a length, on the middle, moves towards off stump, Chanderpaul tries to chop it to third man but gets a inside edge to short fine-leg region

Gayle is gone after a fast and furious knock. Short in length, on the middle stump line, Gayle, again took out the front leg outside the line and tried a swipe across the line but got an top edge to Boucher. What a whirlwind and violent knock this has been. Take a bow
short in length, at the body, lapped around the corner
The sixer man starts off with a nudge to midwicket for a single. It was an attempted yorker- Smith has got out many a time to the yorker- dabbed to the on side
Chanders gives the strike back to Dwayne with a drive to cover
There comes the big Dwayne swing. No contact though. In the zone outside off stump, he wanted to send it over long-on but no wood on leather
yorker length, on the off stump line, chopped down to third man
waist-high full toss, drifting towards the leg stump, Dwayne tries to help it along to the fine leg region, misses and it thuds into the thigh pad. The ball rolls dangerously close to the leg stump

Wood on leather but straight to the man at long-off. Full, outside off and Dwayne connected with his big swing down the ground but couldn't clear long-off. Another one goes down as SA claw their way back into the game.
Hello! Mr Sarwan welcome to Twenty20 says Van der Wath. he hurls across a sharp bouncer and Sarwan manages to fend it off towards point. Ungainly but he is still there.
yorker length, on the off stump, dug out towards long-off
full again, good length this, Chanderpaul goes for a swing across the line, the head bobs all over and he loses control and  just ends up squeezing it past square leg.
Outside edge. Lovely lemon cut or French cut as you please. Full and homing in on the off stump, Chanderpaul tries to slice it through point. Instead the ball runs to third man boundary

Another one goes down. The wickets are suddenly falling in a heap here as West Indies try to hit every ball for a six. Short in length, in the zone outside off, Chanderpaul tries to upper cut it over point but ends up nicking it to Boucher.
short and rising, over the off stump, Ramdin backs away to the leg side and fails to connect with his upper cut
Connects with his upper cut this time. A slight shuffle takes him outside leg stump just before the delivery and he carves a short-of-length delivery over point
fuller this time, on the stumps, driven to long-on
backs to the leg side even as he charges out and slices a yorker through backward point. One frenetic over left in this innings.
full, outside the off stump, he backs away to the leg side but can't put bat to the ball. It landed after it went past the off stump.
Another dot ball. This is rare in this format. Yorker on the middle and off and Sarwan could just about jab it back down the track
full in length, driven towards long-off and Ramdin calls Sarwan over for the second run and they get there in the end. Just in time. It was refered upstairs, not out was the verdict

A one-handed flat six over point! Welcome to Twenty20! It was a low full toss, just outside the off stump, Sarwan backed away and took the bottom-hand off the handle in an effort to reach the delivery and ended up slicing it flat and fast over deep point. Awesome!
Gone now. Fullish, on the leg and middle, almost yorker length and Sarwan gets under the ball and hits it straight to long-on
full and outside off, sliced away past point. West Indies finish on 205.
